arts.ttl: Four Things We Learnt from Tottenhamâ€™s 1-0 Victory over Villarreal
arts.sum: Operating from the right, the former West Ham man stretched Villarreal from the opening minutes, linking well with Pedro Porro and repeatedly getting behind the visitorsâ€™ back line. Tottenhamâ€™s early breakthrough came from that flank: a low cross forced an error from Villarreal goalkeeper Luiz Junior, who bundled the ball into his own net inside four minutes.

arts.ttl: Wayne Rooney and Dimitar Berbatov divided over controversial Micky van de Ven last-man challenge as Tottenham scrape past Villarreal - but should the Spurs star have seen red?
arts.sum: Thomas Frank 's first Champions League game was far from a blockbuster, but Spurs eventually ran out 1-0 winners after a hard-fought clash.

Luiz JÃºnior howler hands Spurs win over Villarreal in nervy elite debut for Frank
arts.athr: David Hytner at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium
arts.sum: But can he do it in the Champions League? It was one of the grumbles from the Tottenham fanbase when their club appointed Thomas Frank given how his experience of European football extended to little more than a handful of Europa League qualifiers with Brondby more than a decade ago. It was a nervy debut for Frank in the big time, his team retreating into their shells after half-time, looking to hold on to the lead they were presented with at the outset by one of the great goalkeeping howlers. It was a moment to haunt Luiz JÃºnior. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Tottenham 1-0 Villarreal: Spurs begin Champions League campaign with a hard-fought win courtesy of early own goal gaffe from goalkeeper Luiz Junior
arts.sum: MATT BARLOW AT THE TOTTENHAM HOTSPUR STADIUM: Victory in Europe, again. Not quite amid jubilant scenes akin to Bilbao in May but the same outcome, a not convincing 1-0 Spurs win.

arts.ttl: Villarreal make Thomas Partey decision for Spurs clash - just hours before ex-Arsenal star is due in court after being charged with five counts of rape
arts.sum: The 32-year-old's trip to London comes mere hours before he is expected at Southwark Crown Court on Wednesday morning to answer charges of rape.

Meanwhile Mathys Tel isnâ€™t in Tottenhamâ€™s Champions League squad, so his place up front is taken by Richarlison. Xavi Simons makes his home debut. Villarreal are captained by defender Juan Foyth, who made 16 Premier League appearances for Spurs between 2017 and 2020. The Yellow Submarine have won five of their last seven European fixtures, and their last two away games in the Champions League group/league phase. Manor Solomon, on loan from Spurs, is eligible to face his parent club and is on the bench. Continue reading...
